discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
There is only one PVDM slot on the motherboard. The Time Division Multiplexing (TDM) cards cannot use the motherboard PVDMs. Dependent upon the number of channels required, the appropriate DSP module is installed on the NIM. For IP services such as to transcode and conference, the PVDM4 DSP module can be installed on the motherboard of the ISR 4000 Series platform.

If the show inventory output shows this information, it signifies that the PVDM card is installed on the motherboard.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/routers/4000-series-integrated-services-routers/118792-config-isr-00.html

I think D

Selected Answer: D
"The on-board PVDMs can be used for conferencing/transcoding but aren't accessible to the NIMs."

Seems to be D.

Selected Answer: A
https://community.cisco.com/t5/collaboration-blogs/introducing-nim-pvdm-dsp-voice-module/ba-p/4176223

NIM-PVDM is the Next-generation digital signal processor (DSP) module with an onboard DSP daughter card which eliminates the need to procure an additional T1/E1 NIM card in order to utilize a PVDM4 chip for IP media services.

questions.question_text: An engineer is configuring a PRI card on a Cisco ISR 4300 Series Router. When the engineer configures the voice PRI on the router, this error is received: "T1 0/1/0: No DSP resources to configure voice feature". Which action must the engineer take to resolve the issue if a PVDM card was installed in the motherboard?

choices.C: Replace the flashcard, restart the router, and try it again.
choices.A: Install the NIM card on a different slot.
choices.D: Install the PVDM directly to the NIM card.
choices.B: Replace the memory slot in the motherboard.

questions.question_text: What is used to create a QoS solution that delivers priority to voice and video traffic across a network?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
You are right. CBWFQ is a congestion management method to guarantee bandwidth to each class of traffic, but it does not deliver priority to voice and video as LLQ method do.
Traffic Policy and Shaping are congestion avoidance methods, they just support QoS in saturated links.
And DiffServ is a QoS model that offer special treatment to the different class of traffic using marking, classification, congestion avoidance, congestion management (LLQ in this case for voice and video priority). So let us choose C.
Reference:
CCNP and CCIE Collaboration Core CLCOR 350-801 Official Cert Guide 2nd Edition
Chapter 13: Layer 2 and Layer 3 QoS Parameters

Selected Answer: C
DiffServ is a model for specifying and enforcing QoS (Quality of Service) across a network. It prioritizes network traffic by classifying and managing network packets based on the type of service they need. This is especially important for voice and video traffic, which require low latency and minimal packet loss.

End-to-end security is standard for all Webex App and Webex Calling customers. But, if you're in a highly regulated industry, Pro Pack features allow you to further control data security and retrieval. The advanced security in Pro Pack provides you with the following customer-controlled security options:

Hybrid Data Security—Manage your encryption keys, decryption keys, and other security services in your own secure on-premises datacenter. For more information, see Hybrid Data Security.

Bring Your Own Main Key – Manage your own keys through Control Hub and revoke or rotate at any time. For more information, see Manage your own customer main key

C

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/np3c1rm/Pro-Pack-For-Control-Hub

questions.question_text: Which data security feature is included with the Pro Pack for Cisco Webex Control Hub?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Phone - Unified Communications Manager (TFTP) - 6970 TCP - HTTP-based download of firmware and configuration files
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/11_5_1/sysConfig/11_5_1_SU1/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1151su1/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1151su1_chapter_01010101.html

Selected Answer: C
"If you want phones to download firmware updates from a server that is not the TFTP server you may configure a “load server” on the phone’s Phone Configuration page. A load server may be another Cisco Unified Communications Manager or a third-party server. A third-party server must be capable of providing any files the phone requests through HTTP on TCP Port 6970 (preferred) or the UDP-based TFTP protocol. Some phone models such as the DX family Cisco TelePresence devices only support HTTP for firmware updates."
Reference: "Administration Guide for Cisco Unified Communications Manager, Release 12.5.1SU1"

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is 6970/TCP

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is 6970/TCP per:

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/11_5_1/sysConfig/11_5_1_SU1/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1151su1/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1151su1_chapter_01010101.html

questions.question_text: By default, IP phones upgrade their images using the HTTP Service from the TFTP Server integrated into one or more of the call processing platforms. Which Port / Transport Protocol does this service use?

choices.A: Restart the DNS server to flush any stale entries
choices.B: Flush the current cache using this CLI command: admin:utils network name-service hosts cache invalidate
choices.D: Flush the current cache using this CLI command: admin:utils network name-service hosts cache validate
choices.C: Delete the arp entry of the host utils network arp delete

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B appears to be correct based on the description of the command

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/cli_ref/12_5_1/cucm_b_cli-reference-guide-1251/cucm_b_cli-reference-guide-1251_chapter_01001.html#CUCM_CL_UEC95B04_00
https://www.examtopics.com/exams/cisco/350-801/view/

Selected Answer: B
A. is incorrect. The flush process must be performed in the client, not in the server.
C. is incorrect. ARP entries are mappings between layer 2 and 3 addresses, not hostnames or FQDNs
D. is incorrect. "utils network name-service hosts cache validate" does not exist.
B. is correct. It is the best answer.

Selected Answer: B
No Command like: cache validate. It is B
